definitions.definition: to be in the right or suitable place

examples.text: Where do these plates belong *(= where are they kept)*?
Are you sure these documents belong together?
Several of the points you raise do not belong in this discussion.
A person like that does not belong in teaching.

definitions.definition: to feel comfortable and happy in a particular situation or with a particular group of people

examples.text: I don't feel as if I belong here.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from be- (as an intensifier) + the archaic verb long ‘belong’, based on Old English gelang ‘at hand, together with’.
